item.title: Report E-2024110163
item.description:
Report E-2024110163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of ethyl methyl Ketone released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum. The release impacted inside trailer floor. Dayton Freight cleaned release using appropriate PPE available on site. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Nov 2nd a package was found during the Am sort that showed signs of leaking. The package contained UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S., 8, II. It appears that the closure was not secured and the chemical leaked out from there. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024110087
item.description:
Report E-2024110087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed a four and a half (4.5) gallon release of product, it was advised the trailer arrived with the product released. The terminal personnel cleaned release using Oil Dri absorbent. Dayton Freight completed cleanup and generated two (2) ten (10) gallon poly drum of waste, one containing spent absorbent and product. The other contained the damaged can container was placed into a separate 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110088
item.description:
Report E-2024110088

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of Sodium Bromide released from one (1) plastic bucket due to improper handling. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) four (4) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the spilled product and spent absorbents. Dayton Freight also generated one (1) ten (10) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the punctured bucket. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110059
item.description:
Report E-2024110059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 0304 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BIN. It was reported that approximately 220-gallons of UN1903 released from a plastic tote due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. Contractors arrived on site applying absorbent to solidify the impacted areas of the dock floor. All spent absorbent and debris were containerized into (7) 55-gallon metal drums. Contractors used poly containers to recoup good product which was then transferred into a new 275-gallon tote - (approximately 150-gallons of product). The waste was staged onsite for terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110050
item.description:
Report E-2024110050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: received 5 drums from Neff Packaging that shipped on a BOL. The material is supposed to be UV INk with a Flash Point >145F. When the lab tested the flash points of the samples all drums had a flash point <100F. We contacted the customer that they sent in an unmanifested/undeclared hazardous waste shipment. We created a hazardous manifest to receive the drum on. The drums should've shipped as a flammable liquid. Once we received all signatures on the hazardous waste manifest we were able to process the material has hazardous waste (waste printing ink related material)

item.title: Report E-2024110070
item.description:
Report E-2024110070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-14
  • City: Portage
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Personnel advised that approximately half a gallon (.5) of product released impacting the cardboard underneath the tote that had been previously placed underneath the metal tote. Hepaco advised that the valve was malfunctioning and that the best solution was to replace it with a new valve. They had to pick up the valve fittings from a vendor and once it was replaced the leaking stopped. The product was transferred into a new poly tote container.

item.title: Report E-2024090554
item.description:
Report E-2024090554

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-06T00:42:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight notified ERTS of a cargo release which resulted in approximately (1) Gallon of ICA Coating released from 5-Gallon metal pail due to skid puncture from the shipper. The release impacted the trailer but no storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used one (1) twenty-five (25) Gallon poly drum for the waste and oil dri for the absorbent used to clean area affected.

item.title: Report E-2024100718
item.description:
Report E-2024100718

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of Toro Oven & Grill Cleaner released from one (1) one (1) gallon plastic jug due to improperly stacked freight. The release impacted the trailer floor. Personnel stated they cleaned up the spill and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste containing the damaged gallon jug partially full of product, along with some impacted cardboard. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100477
item.description:
Report E-2024100477

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-05T12:22:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of UN1263 Valspar Gray Backer released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum due to a puncture caused by an unknown object on the trailer floor. Personnel advised the release impacted the floor of trailer. Dayton Freight confirmed they cleaned the release with Oil Dri absorbent and over packed the punctured drum. Personnel generated one (1) 85-gallon poly drum containing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum of product and one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum containing spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of product released from one (1) metal pail due to improper loading. The personnel advised the release impacted inside of trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. The personnel advised they generated one (1) three (3) gallon poly drum containing spent absorbents and spilled product, along with one (1) ten (10) gallon metal pail containing punctured pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024100369

  • City: GREENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty-five (55) gallons of NA 1993 Stoddard solvent released from one (1) metal drum due to improper loading. They advised the release impacted the inside of the trailer floor, and that they cleaned spill with Oil Dri absorbent. Dayton Freight personnel generated one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbents, PPE, and the damage drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of product released from one (1) metal pail due to getting crushed in transit. The release impacted inside of the trailer floor of trailer #506641. Dayton freight personnel cleaned up the spill using oil dri. Personnel advised they generated one (1) ten (10) gallon metal drum containing punctured drum. The team also generated one (1) five (5) gallon metal drum containing spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
